It's one thing to be irritated with Paul for the shutdown But liberal celeb Bette Midler actually took to Twitter to which of violence upon the senator, asking where is Rand Paul's neighbor when we need him? She's alluding to the attack that left the lawmaker with bruises to his lungs, broken ribs, and eventually, pneumonia. A spokesman for Paul says she should be ashamed, and we can occur. Another absurd shutdown reaction from the left came from MSNBC Host Chris Matthews. Listen.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Picking somebody from one of the coast, usually (Inaudible), and making them the poster person of the Democratic Party is old business for the Republicans. They did it way back to some guy from the '40s, they did it with no absent from West side of New York City. They did it to tip O'Neill, (Inaudible), now they are going after Nancy Pelosi. utterances.speaker: HEGSETH

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, it's horrific. But you know, it's really just a lesson in exactly what not to do. That is not appropriate. It's bad language, and to suggest something like that? utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: And it's not just -- I'm sorry. It's not just what the neighbor did. Remember, Rand Paul was nearly executed on a baseball field with the bunch of other Republicans. Very personal to me, I am a spouse of a Republican congressman. We don't forget. I think it says a lot about the media. Because I bet Bette Midler doesn't even remember that that happened. utterances.speaker: HEGSETH

The problem is, we can't make that joke. She can make that joke. So a liberal can make that joke that a conservative can't, that drives me crazy. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, but it's not funny then. It's not really--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You specialize on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was my joke. But I want to point to a bigger issue. There is a hypocrisy going on, on both sides. The Democrats not care about deficits. The Republicans now don't care about deficits. And it reveals how incapable of the political body is at looking at the future, self- preservation comes first. It's so easy for them to switch sides. We should scream about deficits. We don't scream anymore. And the Democrats are like, oh, you've got to cut spending. Weird training to population not to care about this issue, every time you hear about a possible shutdown, it's like hearing about a Die-Hard sequel. It's like I know how it's going to end! Why do we need to care?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, in terms of expanded spending, the old saying Washington is, people remember when you cut their budget. They don't remember, you know, that you need fiscal restraint. They want -- everybody wants the plums. Everybody wants the program funded that they want funded. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But it's not going to last. It's like a prison there. Is it's a prisoner's dilemma.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The Republicans and the Democrats agreed now to take a hit long- term, the world would be better. But there are like two separated who were decided to nark on each other.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's what sequestration was. The mandatory cuts, that was taking the bitter pill now for the future.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Let me get to the Pelosi -- to Chris Matthews' statement though. So President Trump has said about Nancy Pelosi that she's the GOP secret weapon because she is so bad. And Trump's comment has become popularize. Yet, Chris Matthews said, no, no, no, they are just characterizing her as an ethnic source.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I never -- I never thought that--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What does that mean? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: Mrs. Pelosi as a--

utterances.sentences: She is Native American.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.sentences: Related to?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes. It seems to me that Christopher was suggesting that anybody other than wasp was an ethnic person that the Republicans love to insult. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.sentences: He remembers when I refuse to be discriminated against in our country. You know, the turn of the center.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.sentences: Yes that I think I am from Irish half?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: True. But I think we're destructed by this. To your point, Greg, you know, Rand Paul, sit on the House and Senate floor and said, I ran for office because I was critical to Obama's trillion deficit and by 2019, we're going to be running $1.2 trillion deficits. And he wasn't even up for standing for defense. It's the only reasons conservatives voted for this bill is because they want to fund the Defense Department. He's been a little bit unequivocal on that as well. It's a serious policy at stake.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a theory. If deficits don't matter, if we can add trillions in debt, then let's have a tax holiday for a year where everybody gets -- we don't pay taxes for a year. That will add just 2 trillion, 3 trillion to the debt, who cares? If it doesn't matter, then let us get the money! if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you have been able to bring those up now a few time. It's catching, it's getting some traction I think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just among me.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.sentences: You needed to stay on Fox & friends when the president is watching.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: President Trump talking on Rob Porter's investigation on abuse scandal. That's coming up ahead.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. Today, President Trump commenting on a new controversy swirling the White House. Domestic abuse allegations against former staff Secretary Rob Porter. White House Correspondent Kevin Corke with the details. Kevin. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: KEVIN CORKE, FOX NEWS WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Always great to be on the show with you guys. And this has been a very interesting day here at the White House. The president said bluntly, he was not only surprised by the allegations against his former senior staff secretary, he was frankly shocked at the photos that came out that ultimately led to Rob Porter's dismissal.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I found about it recently. And I was surprised by it. But we certainly wish him well. It's obviously, a tough time for him. He did a very good job when he was in the White House. And we hope he has a wonderful career. And hopefully he will have a great career ahead of him. But it was very sad when we heard about it. Certainly he's also very sad now. He also -- As you probably know, he says he's innocent.

utterances.speaker: CORKE
utterances.sentences: That particular comment certainly raising eyebrows. After all, Porter had been accused by not one but two ex-wives and a former girlfriend of abuse. In fact, this week, a photo of one of his ex-wife surfaced. And that picture with the black eye, says her then husband gave it to her. Now sources also say, White House Chief of Staff John Kelly also aware of the allegations of the abuse, which Porter has strongly denied, but they've seen the photos until this week. White how has been very careful about disclosing who knew, what and when about the allegations. John Kelly is saying in a letter to a staff last night, this is pretty important, I thought he said, we understand the shock, pain, and confusion that these allegations have caused in our workplace. It is important for me to tell you, you're not alone. Resources are available here at the White House or anyone who is seeking counseling. But here's what one of porter's ex-wives said about the abuse last night and her concern for the woman he's dating, White House Communications Director Hope Hicks.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Do you think he's changed?

utterances.speaker: JENNIE WILLOUGHBY, ROB PROTER'S EX-WIFE
utterances.sentences: I don't think he's changed.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did that worry you?

utterances.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
utterances.sentences: It worried me for a lot of reasons. It definitely worries me because if I'm being frank with you, if he hasn't already been abusive with Hope, he will. And particularly now that he's under a lot of stress and scrutiny. That's when the behaviors come out.

utterances.speaker: CORKE
utterances.sentences: Powerful, powerful interview there. Now, the FBI investigation into the allegations was ongoing before his departure here from the White House. And real quick, I want to add one other nugget. Rachel Brand, the No. 3 over at the Department of Justice, has just announced that she will be leaving the DOJ. And to give you sort of a tick-tock of where she falls in the hierarchy, there's Jeff Sessions, of course, the A.G.; there's Rod Rosensteen -- or Rod Rosenstein, who's second in command. She is the No. 3. She's headed over to private-sector work. We are told it is a dream job for her, and that's why she is leaving. Guys, back to you.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Kevin. So Kimberly--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: What do you make of what happened, how it happened, when General Kelly knew? And does that matter?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, well, the reporting there says that General Kelly knew about the allegations but had not seen the photographs. OK, for me, as a former domestic violence prosecutor, I take this very seriously. There is also not only, you know, multiple consistent reports, but there's photographic evidence to document it. And she came out and gave this interview, as well. So if I'm the president, I'm very concerned that he's in this environment. What did his chief of staff know? Why didn't he -- I think, protect the president and make sure, if you had somebody that has these kind of, like, multiple allegations against him, that's very serious.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And working in the White House and that close to the president, you know, you can't have a more important or serious job. So when you have a situation like this, that doesn't -- if true, these allegations, then you know, it doesn't make you suitable for that position whatsoever. And you're putting the president in a compromising position, distracting from the important work that needs to be done. And you saw a statement from General Kelly right away about this.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Where he backed him up, supported Rob, and then had to retract that, so to speak. And then now saying, "OK, well, if anybody needs counseling." Well, this whole thing could have and should have been presented, and it's unfortunate. It puts the president in a very untenable position that is very inappropriate. He shouldn't even be having to comment on this or be brought into a situation of such a serious nature.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Can I -- go ahead.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I just totally agree with Kimberly in terms of the president not being well-served in this whole thing. And General Kelly within the last hour has said, again, that he only found out 40 minutes before he fired him about the picture and about the extent of the proof of the abuse. It just seems to me, although I have tremendous respect and regard for General Kelly and for Hope Hicks, I feel sorry for both of them, it just seems to be almost willful ignorance, if you know what I mean. This guy is such a charmer. He's so effective in his job. You just don't want to believe. You force yourself to look away.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But if he know about this, and he let Hope Hicks, who's working close with the president, you should tell somebody if there's a situation like this, with allegations.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And instead, you encourage her to go ahead and date him? I mean, say that it's OK? I think it's very inappropriate.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Or deference to an FBI background check, which was still open on him. I mean, it's just unclear what -- for General Kelly to put out the statement he did backing him leads me to believe that he had to have incomplete information. Maybe it's willful ignorance. I don't know. But you don't put out a statement that aggressive if you know about something like domestic physical abuse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: You'd never -- you would never back that.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I -- I don't know enough about this. And, you know, there's a lot of denials, all this stuff going around. The one thing I can say is like, you know, I don't know if it was last week or two weeks ago, we did a lot on the Hillary Clinton harassment scandal. A lot on that. And I'm realizing that, you know, none of these stories, these harassment stories, these assault stories, are party specific. So one day, you might get a scalp and be happy that it's Hillary that you -- "Oh, we nailed her!" The next day, it's your party. So you've got to look at every one of these cases, I think, as if it's not part of any party at all. Or if it's part of the party you don't like. So it forces you to be honest and look at this and go, "Well, this isn't right." So that you don't immediately put on a partisan outfit and be defensive about whoever is on your side. You have to look at these without an ideological lens.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Hear, hear.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Fair enough. Hear, hear. All right. Coming up, Kim Jong-un and President Trump crash the opening ceremonies at the Olympics. Fake news or real news? We'll talk about that next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The 2018 Winter Olympics have finally begun. Go Team USA. Always an inspiring fight to watch the parade of nations with Old Glory, our beautiful flag, proudly flying. Also an interesting sight to see athletes from both North Korea and South Korea marching together under one unified flag at the opening ceremonies to the Olympics. And how about the handshake seen around the world? The president of the South exchanging historic greetings with Kim Yo-jong, the sister of the North's strong man. No interaction, though, between little sis and Vice President Mike Pence, although the two did sit close together. The vice president instead accompanying the father of Otto Warmbier, the American student who, as you know, was abused near to death -- he died as soon as he got here -- by his North Korean captors. The vice president also sitting alongside the North Korean defectors, Pence calling on the world not to be fooled by the rogue regime turning on the smiley face. Before I get into a serious discussion, talk to you about smiley face. There was a Trump character there--

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH

utterances.sentences: And Rocket Man character there. Have that shot, the two? There they are.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They're trying to put one over on us so they can continue evolving the nukes there. But at a certain point, in these kind of events, doesn't it become rude not to just shake the guy's hand -- I mean the woman's hand? Not to say, you know, "Why not?"

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I mean, I don't think so. I think it's rude to murder your own people. Which the sister of Kim Jong-un is complicit in in North Korea, a horrendous regime. And then you've got the vice president there with a bunch of defectors from the North--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: -- including Otto Warmbier's father, laying out the contrast to that regime. South Korea is in a different position than we are. South Korea lives on the DMZ with North Korea. So don't give the Olympics a platform to make North Korea look good.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And yet, let the games begin. I mean, isn't the history of the Olympics, you know, this is about sport; it's not about politics?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

They're not fooling anybody. And I'm very tired of misuse of the name Kim. Over and over again. Really, I've never seen -- my name.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They've got to change their name. And yet, Rachel, Nixon went to China. I mean, you know, we embraced Stalin as as our ally in World War II. You know, we judge and we try to be better than they are. But come on, this is about--

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I'm with Pete.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- ice skating.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: First of all, I'm one of the few people -- I don't know how many other people -- I hate the Olympics. I also don't like "Forrest Gump." Maybe this makes me a bad person. But I don't like it, and I think this has been the only interesting thing for me. I agree with you guys that -- that the president should give them the cold shoulder. I got upset when President Obama had the baseball game with Raul Castro. I don't like our presidents rubbing shoulders with dictators that are really cruel and evil to their citizens. So I'm I'm with you, Kimberly, on this.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I was in South Korea when they reached across the DMZ to--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are everywhere!

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But the relatives of the South were being reunited via television with the cousins, and aunties, and uncles and grandparents they had never seen. And it was a moment in Korea of great hopefulness that maybe the strict division between North and South, this fault line, could be bridged, at least in some humanitarian way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, I hope you're right. Because I think that's the only answer. And I think people are -- I mean, right now, the whole story is not the Olympics, it's what's going on right now with the sanctions. And the reality is there's going to be millions of people starving to death. And people who are starving to death don't fight wars. So the change is going to be from within. They're going to go after that regime at a certain point. And the specter of Otto should be hanging over this Olympics. If I were to draw, like, an editorial cartoon, you'd have a packed stadium, and you'd have Otto looking down, judging those who should be judged. And remember that humorous thing, the display of the fake Trump and the fake Kim Jong-un. We can laugh about it. But if that were to happen in North Korea, they would hunt those two people down and kill them.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think that the -- Otto Warmbier is there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And I think that their effect (ph). Stay right there. "Facebook Friday" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes! "Facebook Friday." It's Friday, so it's Facebook. All right. First question from Jackie S.: "If you could turn any activity," -- any activity, Pete -- "into an Olympic sport" -- keep it clean -- "what you would have a good -- what would you have a good chance at winning a medal for?"

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Something that's not alcohol based.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I was going to say.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I would say cliff jumping. I'd like to see a little bit more extreme.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you cliff jump?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I used to cliff jump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Off the shores of the St. Croix River between Minnesota and Wisconsin. I feel like we should have a how high you should jump from--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I used to jump men named Cliff. That's not it. I was thinking of something more fun.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What's wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That's fun!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it really?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: It's a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Too close to a sport. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What activity could you turn into an Olympic sport?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: As if I'm going to answer this. We're going to go with chicken wings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Chicken wings? Yes, that's true. You're an amazing chicken wing eater.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, no, really. Look it up on YouTube. Everyone is, like, "Wait a second. Is that tape sped up?" It is in real time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How about Rachel? I know -- I have one for you, but you go ahead.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I bet it's the same one I'm going to pick. If there's one I can win at, I would say "pregnancy/childbirth."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I have great pregnancies. I have very easy childbirth.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Thanks be to God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You have eight medals. You have eight metals.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Thanks be to God. I have eight gold medals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. My goodness. Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Belly-flopping in the nude down the ice slope.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why does it have to be nude, Geraldo? Why does it have to be nude?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Puerto Rican bobsledding.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Can I be part of the Puerto Rican bobsled team?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hear millions of people retching right now. You know what?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: About who?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My activity? My activity?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Caring.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, right! You wouldn't -- you are the least. You wouldn't even medal. You wouldn't even qualify! No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I care about you, Kimberly. I worry sometimes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, that's called obsession.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

So, again, when the left just goes totally absolutely absurd, they're only weakening their own position, their own character, their own integrity to lack there up by making these kind of like personal attacks and wishing violence on another person.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: And it's not just -- I'm sorry. It's not just what the neighbor did. Remember, Rand Paul was nearly executed on a baseball field with the bunch of other Republicans. Very personal to me, I am a spouse of a Republican congressman. We don't forget. I think it says a lot about the media. Because I bet Bette Midler doesn't even remember that that happened. Had this happen to Democrats, this would be front and center because that story went away and I took notice of it. The story of what happened on the baseball field when away within 12 days. That's how they treat violence against Republicans and threats like this go, this is nothing.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What's her name?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Midler or Chris Matthews?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I want to talk also just about the bunch of -- but the problem with the Midler thing is that it's a joke, OK? It's a joke. We know it's a joke. Let's not forget it's a joke. The problem is, we can't make that joke. She can make that joke. So a liberal can make that joke that a conservative can't, that drives me crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, but it's not funny then. It's not really--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, I should know, jokes don't have to be funny.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You specialize on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was my joke. But I want to point to a bigger issue. There is a hypocrisy going on, on both sides. The Democrats not care about deficits. The Republicans now don't care about deficits. And it reveals how incapable of the political body is at looking at the future, self- preservation comes first. It's so easy for them to switch sides. We should scream about deficits. We don't scream anymore. And the Democrats are like, oh, you've got to cut spending. Weird training to population not to care about this issue, every time you hear about a possible shutdown, it's like hearing about a Die-Hard sequel. It's like I know how it's going to end! Why do we need to care?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You know, in terms of expanded spending, the old saying Washington is, people remember when you cut their budget. They don't remember, you know, that you need fiscal restraint. They want -- everybody wants the plums. Everybody wants the program funded that they want funded.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But it's not going to last. It's like a prison there. Is it's a prisoner's dilemma.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The Republicans and the Democrats agreed now to take a hit long- term, the world would be better. But there are like two separated who were decided to nark on each other.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's what sequestration was. The mandatory cuts, that was taking the bitter pill now for the future.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Let me get to the Pelosi -- to Chris Matthews' statement though. So President Trump has said about Nancy Pelosi that she's the GOP secret weapon because she is so bad. And Trump's comment has become popularize. Yet, Chris Matthews said, no, no, no, they are just characterizing her as an ethnic source.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, I never -- I never thought that--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What does that mean?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Mrs. Pelosi as a--

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: That she's Italian?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She's Italian but didn't she say she had English, in this and that, and everything else? I don't know. I think it's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is Native American.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: Related to?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes. It seems to me that Christopher was suggesting that anybody other than wasp was an ethnic person that the Republicans love to insult.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: He remembers when I refuse to be discriminated against in our country. You know, the turn of the center.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wasn't that long ago?

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: Yes that I think I am from Irish half?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: True. But I think we're destructed by this. To your point, Greg, you know, Rand Paul, sit on the House and Senate floor and said, I ran for office because I was critical to Obama's trillion deficit and by 2019, we're going to be running $1.2 trillion deficits. And he wasn't even up for standing for defense. It's the only reasons conservatives voted for this bill is because they want to fund the Defense Department. He's been a little bit unequivocal on that as well. It's a serious policy at stake.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have a theory. If deficits don't matter, if we can add trillions in debt, then let's have a tax holiday for a year where everybody gets -- we don't pay taxes for a year. That will add just 2 trillion, 3 trillion to the debt, who cares? If it doesn't matter, then let us get the money!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, you have been able to bring those up now a few time. It's catching, it's getting some traction I think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just among me.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: You needed to stay on Fox & friends when the president is watching.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: President Trump talking on Rob Porter's investigation on abuse scandal. That's coming up ahead.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFF
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Today, President Trump commenting on a new controversy swirling the White House. Domestic abuse allegations against former staff Secretary Rob Porter. White House Correspondent Kevin Corke with the details. Kevin.

utterances.speaker: KEVIN CORKE, FOX NEWS WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Always great to be on the show with you guys. And this has been a very interesting day here at the White House. The president said bluntly, he was not only surprised by the allegations against his former senior staff secretary, he was frankly shocked at the photos that came out that ultimately led to Rob Porter's dismissal.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I found about it recently. And I was surprised by it. But we certainly wish him well. It's obviously, a tough time for him. He did a very good job when he was in the White House. And we hope he has a wonderful career. And hopefully he will have a great career ahead of him. But it was very sad when we heard about it. Certainly he's also very sad now. He also -- As you probably know, he says he's innocent.

utterances.speaker: CORKE
utterances.utterance: That particular comment certainly raising eyebrows. After all, Porter had been accused by not one but two ex-wives and a former girlfriend of abuse. In fact, this week, a photo of one of his ex-wife surfaced. And that picture with the black eye, says her then husband gave it to her. Now sources also say, White House Chief of Staff John Kelly also aware of the allegations of the abuse, which Porter has strongly denied, but they've seen the photos until this week. White how has been very careful about disclosing who knew, what and when about the allegations. John Kelly is saying in a letter to a staff last night, this is pretty important, I thought he said, we understand the shock, pain, and confusion that these allegations have caused in our workplace. It is important for me to tell you, you're not alone. Resources are available here at the White House or anyone who is seeking counseling. But here's what one of porter's ex-wives said about the abuse last night and her concern for the woman he's dating, White House Communications Director Hope Hicks.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Do you think he's changed?

utterances.speaker: JENNIE WILLOUGHBY, ROB PROTER'S EX-WIFE
utterances.utterance: I don't think he's changed.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: Did that worry you?

utterances.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
utterances.utterance: It worried me for a lot of reasons. It definitely worries me because if I'm being frank with you, if he hasn't already been abusive with Hope, he will. And particularly now that he's under a lot of stress and scrutiny. That's when the behaviors come out.

utterances.speaker: CORKE
utterances.utterance: Powerful, powerful interview there. Now, the FBI investigation into the allegations was ongoing before his departure here from the White House. And real quick, I want to add one other nugget. Rachel Brand, the No. 3 over at the Department of Justice, has just announced that she will be leaving the DOJ. And to give you sort of a tick-tock of where she falls in the hierarchy, there's Jeff Sessions, of course, the A.G.; there's Rod Rosensteen -- or Rod Rosenstein, who's second in command. She is the No. 3. She's headed over to private-sector work. We are told it is a dream job for her, and that's why she is leaving. Guys, back to you.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Kevin. So Kimberly--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: What do you make of what happened, how it happened, when General Kelly knew? And does that matter?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, well, the reporting there says that General Kelly knew about the allegations but had not seen the photographs. OK, for me, as a former domestic violence prosecutor, I take this very seriously. There is also not only, you know, multiple consistent reports, but there's photographic evidence to document it. And she came out and gave this interview, as well. So if I'm the president, I'm very concerned that he's in this environment. What did his chief of staff know? Why didn't he -- I think, protect the president and make sure, if you had somebody that has these kind of, like, multiple allegations against him, that's very serious.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And working in the White House and that close to the president, you know, you can't have a more important or serious job. So when you have a situation like this, that doesn't -- if true, these allegations, then you know, it doesn't make you suitable for that position whatsoever. And you're putting the president in a compromising position, distracting from the important work that needs to be done. And you saw a statement from General Kelly right away about this.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Where he backed him up, supported Rob, and then had to retract that, so to speak. And then now saying, "OK, well, if anybody needs counseling." Well, this whole thing could have and should have been presented, and it's unfortunate. It puts the president in a very untenable position that is very inappropriate. He shouldn't even be having to comment on this or be brought into a situation of such a serious nature.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Can I -- go ahead.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I just totally agree with Kimberly in terms of the president not being well-served in this whole thing. And General Kelly within the last hour has said, again, that he only found out 40 minutes before he fired him about the picture and about the extent of the proof of the abuse. It just seems to me, although I have tremendous respect and regard for General Kelly and for Hope Hicks, I feel sorry for both of them, it just seems to be almost willful ignorance, if you know what I mean. This guy is such a charmer. He's so effective in his job. You just don't want to believe. You force yourself to look away.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But if he know about this, and he let Hope Hicks, who's working close with the president, you should tell somebody if there's a situation like this, with allegations.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And instead, you encourage her to go ahead and date him? I mean, say that it's OK? I think it's very inappropriate.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Or deference to an FBI background check, which was still open on him. I mean, it's just unclear what -- for General Kelly to put out the statement he did backing him leads me to believe that he had to have incomplete information. Maybe it's willful ignorance. I don't know. But you don't put out a statement that aggressive if you know about something like domestic physical abuse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You'd never -- you would never back that.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I -- I don't know enough about this. And, you know, there's a lot of denials, all this stuff going around. The one thing I can say is like, you know, I don't know if it was last week or two weeks ago, we did a lot on the Hillary Clinton harassment scandal. A lot on that. And I'm realizing that, you know, none of these stories, these harassment stories, these assault stories, are party specific. So one day, you might get a scalp and be happy that it's Hillary that you -- "Oh, we nailed her!" The next day, it's your party. So you've got to look at every one of these cases, I think, as if it's not part of any party at all. Or if it's part of the party you don't like. So it forces you to be honest and look at this and go, "Well, this isn't right." So that you don't immediately put on a partisan outfit and be defensive about whoever is on your side. You have to look at these without an ideological lens.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Hear, hear.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Fair enough. Hear, hear. All right. Coming up, Kim Jong-un and President Trump crash the opening ceremonies at the Olympics. Fake news or real news? We'll talk about that next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The 2018 Winter Olympics have finally begun. Go Team USA. Always an inspiring fight to watch the parade of nations with Old Glory, our beautiful flag, proudly flying. Also an interesting sight to see athletes from both North Korea and South Korea marching together under one unified flag at the opening ceremonies to the Olympics. And how about the handshake seen around the world? The president of the South exchanging historic greetings with Kim Yo-jong, the sister of the North's strong man. No interaction, though, between little sis and Vice President Mike Pence, although the two did sit close together. The vice president instead accompanying the father of Otto Warmbier, the American student who, as you know, was abused near to death -- he died as soon as he got here -- by his North Korean captors. The vice president also sitting alongside the North Korean defectors, Pence calling on the world not to be fooled by the rogue regime turning on the smiley face. Before I get into a serious discussion, talk to you about smiley face. There was a Trump character there--

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Impersonator.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And Rocket Man character there. Have that shot, the two? There they are.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: That's pretty good, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why did they go with, like, a handsome Kim Jong-un? Look what they did to President Trump.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That was biased.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You know, the one thing, Pete, about the vice president's very measured, standoffish stance when he came to embracing the North. I think that, at a certain point, I get the message that the vice president is trying to convey. We don't buy the North Korean charm offensive.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They're trying to put one over on us so they can continue evolving the nukes there. But at a certain point, in these kind of events, doesn't it become rude not to just shake the guy's hand -- I mean the woman's hand? Not to say, you know, "Why not?"

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I mean, I don't think so. I think it's rude to murder your own people. Which the sister of Kim Jong-un is complicit in in North Korea, a horrendous regime. And so I think the vice president set the perfect tone. You've got the sister of the dictator on a charm offensive there, surrounded by body guards. And then you've got the vice president there with a bunch of defectors from the North--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: -- including Otto Warmbier's father, laying out the contrast to that regime. South Korea is in a different position than we are. South Korea lives on the DMZ with North Korea. They're forced to play ball a little bit more than we have to. As the global guarantor of security, the ones that would deal with an actual denuclearization of that -- of that peninsula, we've got to take that strong stance and let them know we're not going to bend one inch. So don't give the Olympics a platform to make North Korea look good.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And yet, let the games begin. I mean, isn't the history of the Olympics, you know, this is about sport; it's not about politics?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, it should be about, also, murderous regimes that do that, that brutalize not only their own people but have murdered Americans. So me, I think it's an important point. They're not fooling anybody. And I'm very tired of misuse of the name Kim. Over and over again. Really, I've never seen -- my name.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They've got to change their name. And yet, Rachel, Nixon went to China. I mean, you know, we embraced Stalin as as our ally in World War II. You know, we judge and we try to be better than they are. But come on, this is about--

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: I'm with Pete.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- ice skating.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: First of all, I'm one of the few people -- I don't know how many other people -- I hate the Olympics. I also don't like "Forrest Gump." Maybe this makes me a bad person. But I don't like it, and I think this has been the only interesting thing for me. I agree with you guys that -- that the president should give them the cold shoulder. I got upset when President Obama had the baseball game with Raul Castro. I don't like our presidents rubbing shoulders with dictators that are really cruel and evil to their citizens. So I'm I'm with you, Kimberly, on this.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was in South Korea when they reached across the DMZ to--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are everywhere!

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But the relatives of the South were being reunited via television with the cousins, and aunties, and uncles and grandparents they had never seen. And it was a moment in Korea of great hopefulness that maybe the strict division between North and South, this fault line, could be bridged, at least in some humanitarian way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, I hope you're right. Because I think that's the only answer. And I think people are -- I mean, right now, the whole story is not the Olympics, it's what's going on right now with the sanctions. And the reality is there's going to be millions of people starving to death. And people who are starving to death don't fight wars. So the change is going to be from within. They're going to go after that regime at a certain point. And the specter of Otto should be hanging over this Olympics. If I were to draw, like, an editorial cartoon, you'd have a packed stadium, and you'd have Otto looking down, judging those who should be judged. And remember that humorous thing, the display of the fake Trump and the fake Kim Jong-un. We can laugh about it. But if that were to happen in North Korea, they would hunt those two people down and kill them.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think that the -- Otto Warmbier is there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And I think that their effect (ph). Stay right there. "Facebook Friday" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes! "Facebook Friday." It's Friday, so it's Facebook.

utterances.speaker: All right. First question from Jackie S.
utterances.utterance: "If you could turn any activity," -- any activity, Pete -- "into an Olympic sport" -- keep it clean -- "what you would have a good -- what would you have a good chance at winning a medal for?"

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Something that's not alcohol based.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was going to say.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I would say cliff jumping. I'd like to see a little bit more extreme.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you cliff jump?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I used to cliff jump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Off the shores of the St. Croix River between Minnesota and Wisconsin. I feel like we should have a how high you should jump from--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I used to jump men named Cliff. That's not it. I was thinking of something more fun.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What's wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's fun!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it really?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It's a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Too close to a sport. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What activity could you turn into an Olympic sport?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: As if I'm going to answer this. We're going to go with chicken wings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Chicken wings? Yes, that's true. You're an amazing chicken wing eater.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, no, really. Look it up on YouTube. Everyone is, like, "Wait a second. Is that tape sped up?" It is in real time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How about Rachel? I know -- I have one for you, but you go ahead.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: I bet it's the same one I'm going to pick. If there's one I can win at, I would say "pregnancy/childbirth."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: I have great pregnancies. I have very easy childbirth.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thanks be to God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have eight medals. You have eight metals.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Thanks be to God. I have eight gold medals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. My goodness. Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Belly-flopping in the nude down the ice slope.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why does it have to be nude, Geraldo? Why does it have to be nude?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Puerto Rican bobsledding.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Can I be part of the Puerto Rican bobsled team?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hear millions of people retching right now. You know what?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: About who?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My activity? My activity?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Caring.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, right! You wouldn't -- you are the least. You wouldn't even medal. You wouldn't even qualify! No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I care about you, Kimberly. I worry sometimes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, that's called obsession.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. It's not obsession if it's healthy. Especially if you stay out of the restraining order range.

utterances.speaker: All right. Ron G. Now, this is a difficult question. So it's OK if you don't want to answer this, but it's a difficult question. This is from Ron G.
utterances.utterance: "Do you have an old flame, high school or college, you haven't seen or talked to in a long time that you would like to see again to catch up?" Rachel.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: The answer is no. Once I met my husband, who is a very sexy lumberjack, I never had eyes for anyone else.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You never had time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Eight babies.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: For me, it's not about -- it's not about eyes for anybody. It's about insight. There was a girl that I dated, like, twice in college, and I went in to kiss her on our second date and she leaned out. You know, the lean in, lean out. What did I do?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you want to meet her for coffee and ask what you did?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I just want to know what did I do wrong! How did I fail so miserably?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is, like, 20 years ago. Right?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And so you're still thinking about it?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: She went on to marry a pro baseball player, which I'm definitely not.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You were a basketball player.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: When I had my old daytime show, my staff on the -- one anniversary, I think it was the 20th anniversary of my high school graduation, had my high school girlfriend show up. And it just -- I said, "What are you doing? You just messed up the whole tempo of your life. You can't go back." You know, maybe you hear an Adele song and you pine for 15 seconds. You can't go back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you remember what your show did to Bill Schultz? That just made me think of this. Do you remember when you had people -- what did they do?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: On his show?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We'll get to it in the break.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're like senile around here. What is the question? Is there a--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is there an ex- from high school or college you'd like to meet for coffee?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can't say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you can. Give us a hint. Surely you can hint.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Finish the drink if it makes it easier.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: An ex-boyfriend?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Or a flame or ex-.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: It's not healthy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I had a nice coffee with a friend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What you're saying, it's never good to look back. You should always look ahead. Because you're cheating on the people that you're with now if you're looking back.
